fragment: Walter White, a high school chemistry teacher, uses his chemistry expertise to cook crystal meth after being diagnosed with terminal lung cancer.
Jesse Pinkman, a former student of Walter White, becomes his partner in the methamphetamine production business.
Skyler White, Walter's wife, becomes involved in his illegal activities and helps him launder money.
Hank Schrader, Walter's brother-in-law, is a DEA agent who becomes obsessed with tracking down the mysterious drug lord known as Heisenberg.
Marie Schrader, Hank's wife, is a kleptomaniac and becomes entangled in the criminal activities of her brother-in-law.
Saul Goodman, a criminal lawyer, becomes Walter and Jesse's legal counsel and helps them navigate the dangerous world of drug trafficking.
Gustavo Fring, a prominent businessman and drug lord, becomes a major adversary for Walter and Jesse.
Mike Ehrmantraut, a former police officer and hitman, becomes a trusted associate of Gus and later works with Walter and Jesse.
Tuco Salamanca, a violent and unpredictable drug dealer, becomes an early antagonist for Walter and Jesse.
Hector Salamanca, Tuco's uncle, is a former cartel member and becomes a key player in the later seasons of the show.
